meanings.sent1: The movie was wack because the acting was not good.
meanings.sent2: The old phone is wack compared to the new model.
meanings.sent3: Eating ice cream with ketchup would be wack!
meanings.sent4: His excuse for being late was as wack as a broken clock.
meanings.sent5: The smell in the room was so wack, it made everyone leave.

meanings.sent1: He wacked the ball with all his strength.
meanings.sent2: The boxer wacked his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: She wacked the pinata so hard, the candies flew everywhere!
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm wacked the trees with fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The chef wacked the dough to make it flat for the pizza.

meanings.sent1: After the roller coaster ride, she felt like her mind was wacking out.
meanings.sent2: The idea of jumping off a plane without a parachute is wack!
meanings.sent3: The cat wacked around the house in a frenzy.
meanings.sent4: His sudden decision to quit his job wacked everyone in the office.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious painting made her feel like reality was wacking away.
